StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [InsertUpdateRSSDSSector]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@RssDsSectorId uniqueidentifier = null, @RssOrgId int = null, @FiscalYear int = null, @SectorDesignator varchar(10) = null, @SectorProblems varchar(500) = null, @LastUpdateUserID uniqueidentifier
AS BEGIN
-- STEP 1: Start the transac.on BEGIN TRANSACTION declare @RssDsId uniqueidentifier --select @RssDsId = null
-- STEP 2 & 3: Issue the data change statement(s), checking @@ERROR a.er each statement IF EXISTS(SELECT * FROM [USMC].[RssDataSheetSector] WHERE RssDataSheetSectorId = @RssDsSectorId) BEGIN -- if @intCount > 0, then the Record already exists. UPDATE. UPDATE [USMC].[RssDataSheetSector] SET SectorProblems = @SectorProblems WHERE RssDataSheetSectorId = @RssDsSectorId
END ELSE BEGIN select @RssDsId=RssDataSheetId FROM [USMC].[RssDataSheet] WHERE RssOrgId = @RssOrgId and FysicalYear = @FiscalYear
if (@RssDsId is null) Begin select @RssDsId = newid() INSERT INTO [USMC].[RssDataSheet] (RssDataSheetId, RssOrgId, FysicalYear, LastupdateDate, LastUpdateUserId) VALUES (@RssDsId, @RssOrgId, @FiscalYear, getdate(), @LastUpdateUserID) END
insert into [USMC].[RssDataSheetSector] ( RssDataSheetSectorId, RssDataSheetId, SectorDesignator, SectorProblems ) VALUES ( newid(), @RssDsId, @SectorDesignator, @SectorProblems )
END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- STEP 4: If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully -- Commit the transac.on.... COMMIT TRANSACTION
END
